intro: Psychotria kassneri, commonly known as the Kassner's Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental or medicinal value. The plant features elliptical, dark green leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Psychotria kassneri is often found growing in shaded, humid environments, typically along forest floors or in undergrowth.
